briefdescription.para: Runs the given JavaScript code.

detaileddescription.para: This function has a few platform-specific limitations:

listitem.para: When using WebKit v1 in wxGTK2, retrieving the result of JavaScript execution is unsupported and this function will always return false if output is non-null to indicate this. This functionality is fully supported when using WebKit v2 or later in wxGTK3.
When using WebKit under macOS, code execution is limited to at most 10MiB of memory and 10 seconds of execution time.

When using IE backend under MSW, scripts can only be executed when the current page is fully loaded (i.e. wxEVT_WEBVIEW_LOADED event was received). A script tag inside the page HTML is required in order to run JavaScript.

detaileddescription.para: Also notice that under MSW converting JavaScript objects to JSON is not supported in the default emulation mode. wxWebView implements its own object-to-JSON conversion as a fallback for this case, however it is not as full-featured, well-tested or performing as the implementation of this functionality in the browser control itself, so it is recommended to use MSWSetEmulationLevel() to change emulation level to a more modern one in which JSON conversion is done by the control itself.

parameterdescription.para: JavaScript code to execute.
Pointer to a string to be filled with the result value or NULL if it is not needed. This parameter is new since wxWidgets version 3.1.1.

simplesect.para: true if there is a result, false if there is an error.

briefdescription.para: Runs the given JavaScript code asynchronously and returns the result via a wxEVT_WEBVIEW_SCRIPT_RESULT.

detaileddescription.para: The script result value can be retrieved via wxWebViewEvent::GetString(). If the execution fails wxWebViewEvent::IsError() will return true. In this case additional script execution error information maybe available via wxWebViewEvent::GetString().

parameterdescription.para: JavaScript code to execute.
Arbirary pointer to data that can be retrieved from the result event.

simplesect.para: The IE backend does not support async script execution.

briefdescription.para: Add a script message handler with the given name.

detaileddescription.para: To use the script message handler from javascript use `window.<name>.postMessage(<messageBody>)` where <name> corresponds the value of the name parameter. The <messageBody> will be available to the application via a wxEVT_WEBVIEW_SCRIPT_MESSAGE_RECEIVED event.
Sample javascript sending a script message: //Sendsamplemessagebody window.wx_msg.postMessage('Thisisamessagebody');

parameterdescription.para: Name of the message handler that can be used from javascript

simplesect.para: true if the handler could be added, false if it could not be added.
The Edge backend only supports a single message handler and the IE backend does not support script message handlers.

briefdescription.para: Remove a script message handler with the given name that was previously added via AddScriptMessageHandler().

simplesect.para: true if the handler could be removed, false if it could not be removed.

briefdescription.para: Injects the specified script into the webpage's content.

parameterdescription.para: The javascript code to add.
Specifies when the script will be executed.

simplesect.para: Returns true if the script was added successfully.
Please note that this is unsupported by the IE backend and the Edge backend does only support wxWEBVIEW_INJECT_AT_DOCUMENT_START.

briefdescription.para: Removes all user scripts from the web view.
Returns true if the current selection can be copied.
Returns true if the current selection can be cut.
Returns true if data can be pasted.
Copies the current selection.
Cuts the current selection.
Pastes the current data.
Enable or disable the right click context menu.

detaileddescription.para: By default the standard context menu is enabled, this method can be used to disable it or re-enable it later.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if a context menu will be shown on right click.
Enable or disable access to dev tools for the user.

detaileddescription.para: Dev tools are disabled by default.

simplesect.para: This is not implemented for the IE backend.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if dev tools are available to the user.
Specify a custom user agent string for the web view.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true the user agent could be set.
If your first request should already use the custom user agent please use two step creation and call SetUserAgent() before Create().

simplesect.para: This is not implemented for IE. For Edge SetUserAgent() MUST be called before Create().

briefdescription.para: Returns the current user agent string for the web view.
Returns true if it is possible to navigate backward in the history of visited pages.
Returns true if it is possible to navigate forward in the history of visited pages.
Clear the history, this will also remove the visible page.

simplesect.para: This is not implemented on the WebKit2GTK+ backend and macOS.

briefdescription.para: Enable or disable the history.

detaileddescription.para: This will also clear the history.

simplesect.para: This is not implemented on the WebKit2GTK+ backend and macOS.

briefdescription.para: Returns a list of items in the back history.

detaileddescription.para: The first item in the vector is the first page that was loaded by the control.

briefdescription.para: Returns a list of items in the forward history.

detaileddescription.para: The first item in the vector is the next item in the history with respect to the currently loaded page.

briefdescription.para: Navigate back in the history of visited pages.

detaileddescription.para: Only valid if CanGoBack() returns true.

briefdescription.para: Navigate forward in the history of visited pages.

detaileddescription.para: Only valid if CanGoForward() returns true.

briefdescription.para: Loads a history item.
Clears the current selection.
Deletes the current selection.

detaileddescription.para: Note that for wxWEBVIEW_BACKEND_WEBKIT the selection must be editable, either through SetEditable or the correct HTML attribute.

briefdescription.para: Returns the currently selected source, if any.
Returns the currently selected text, if any.
Returns true if there is a current selection.
Selects the entire page.
Returns true if there is an action to redo.
Returns true if there is an action to undo.
Redos the last action.
Undos the last action.
Finds a phrase on the current page and if found, the control will scroll the phrase into view and select it.

parameterdescription.para: The phrase to search for.
The flags for the search.

simplesect.para: If search phrase was not found in combination with the flags then wxNOT_FOUND is returned. If called for the first time with search phrase then the total number of results will be returned. Then for every time its called with the same search phrase it will return the number of the current match.

This function will restart the search if the flags wxWEBVIEW_FIND_ENTIRE_WORD or wxWEBVIEW_FIND_MATCH_CASE are changed, since this will require a new search. To reset the search, for example resetting the highlights call the function with an empty search phrase.

briefdescription.para: Retrieve whether the current HTML engine supports a zoom type.

parameterdescription.para: The zoom type to test.

simplesect.para: Whether this type of zoom is supported by this HTML engine (and thus can be set through SetZoomType()).

briefdescription.para: Get the zoom level of the page.

detaileddescription.para:
See GetZoomFactor() to get more precise zoom scale value other than as provided by wxWebViewZoom.
The current level of zoom.

briefdescription.para: Get the zoom factor of the page.

simplesect.para: The current factor of zoom.

briefdescription.para: Get how the zoom factor is currently interpreted.

simplesect.para: How the zoom factor is currently interpreted by the HTML engine.

briefdescription.para: Set the zoom level of the page.

detaileddescription.para:
See SetZoomFactor() for more precise scaling other than the measured steps provided by wxWebViewZoom.
zoom
How much to zoom (scale) the HTML document.

briefdescription.para: Set the zoom factor of the page.

parameterdescription.para: How much to zoom (scale) the HTML document in arbitrary number.

simplesect.para: zoom scale in IE will be converted into wxWebViewZoom levels for wxWebViewZoomType of wxWEBVIEW_ZOOM_TYPE_TEXT.

briefdescription.para: Set how to interpret the zoom factor.

parameterdescription.para: How the zoom factor should be interpreted by the HTML engine.

simplesect.para: invoke CanSetZoomType() first, some HTML renderers may not support all zoom types.

memberdef.argsstring: (wxWindow *parent, wxWindowID id, const wxString &url=wxWebViewDefaultURLStr, const wxPoint &pos=wxDefaultPosition, const wxSize &size=wxDefaultSize, long style=0, const wxString &name=wxWebViewNameStr)=0
memberdef.name: Create

briefdescription.para: Creation function for two-step creation.
Get the title of the current web page, or its URL/path if title is not available.
Get the URL of the currently displayed document.
Return the pointer to the native backend used by this control.

detaileddescription.para: This method can be used to retrieve the pointer to the native rendering engine used by this control. The return value needs to be down-casted to the appropriate type depending on the platform: under Windows, it's a pointer to IWebBrowser2 interface, under macOS it's a WebView pointer and under GTK it's a WebKitWebView.

briefdescription.para: Get the HTML source code of the currently displayed document.

simplesect.para: The HTML source code, or an empty string if no page is currently shown.

briefdescription.para: Get the text of the current page.
Returns whether the web control is currently busy (e.g. loading a page).
Returns whether the web control is currently editable.
Load a web page from a URL.

parameterdescription.para: The URL of the page to be loaded.

simplesect.para: Web engines generally report errors asynchronously, so if you wish to know whether loading the URL was successful, register to receive navigation error events.

briefdescription.para: Opens a print dialog so that the user may print the currently displayed page.
Registers a custom scheme handler.

parameterdescription.para: A shared pointer to a wxWebHandler.

simplesect.para: On macOS in order to use handlers two-step creation has to be used and RegisterHandler() has to be called before Create(). With the other backends it has to be called after Create().

briefdescription.para: Reload the currently displayed URL.

parameterdescription.para: A bit array that may optionally contain reload options.

simplesect.para: The flags are ignored by the Edge backend.

briefdescription.para: Set the editable property of the web control.

detaileddescription.para: Enabling allows the user to edit the page even if the contenteditable attribute is not set. The exact capabilities vary with the backend being used.

simplesect.para: This is not implemented for macOS and the Edge backend.

briefdescription.para: Set the displayed page source to the contents of the given string.

parameterdescription.para: The string that contains the HTML data to display.
URL assigned to the HTML data, to be used to resolve relative paths, for instance.

simplesect.para: When using wxWEBVIEW_BACKEND_IE you must wait for the current page to finish loading before calling SetPage(). The baseURL parameter is not used in this backend and the Edge backend.

briefdescription.para: Set the displayed page source to the contents of the given stream.

parameterdescription.para: The stream to read HTML data from.
URL assigned to the HTML data, to be used to resolve relative paths, for instance.

briefdescription.para: Stop the current page loading process, if any.

detaileddescription.para: May trigger an error event of type wxWEBVIEW_NAV_ERR_USER_CANCELLED. TODO: make wxWEBVIEW_NAV_ERR_USER_CANCELLED errors uniform across ports.

briefdescription.para: Factory function to create a new wxWebView with two-step creation, wxWebView::Create should be called on the returned object.

parameterdescription.para: The backend web rendering engine to use. wxWebViewBackendDefault, wxWebViewBackendIE and wxWebViewBackendWebKit are predefined where appropriate.

simplesect.para: The created wxWebView

memberdef.argsstring: (wxWindow *parent, wxWindowID id, const wxString &url=wxWebViewDefaultURLStr, const wxPoint &pos=wxDefaultPosition, const wxSize &size=wxDefaultSize, const wxString &backend=wxWebViewBackendDefault, long style=0, const wxString &name=wxWebViewNameStr)

briefdescription.para: Factory function to create a new wxWebView using a wxWebViewFactory.

parameterdescription.para: Parent window for the control
ID of this control
Initial URL to load
Position of the control
Size of the control
The backend web rendering engine to use. wxWebViewBackendDefault, wxWebViewBackendIE and wxWebViewBackendWebKit are predefined where appropriate.
Window style. For generic window styles, please see wxWindow.
Window name.

simplesect.para: The created wxWebView, or NULL if the requested backend is not available

briefdescription.para: Allows the registering of new backend for wxWebView.

detaileddescription.para:
backend can be used as an argument to New().
backend
The name for the new backend to be registered under
factory
A shared pointer to the factory which creates the appropriate backend.
2.9.5

briefdescription.para: Allows to check if a specific backend is currently available.
Retrieve the version information about the backend implementation.
This control may be used to render web (HTML / CSS / javascript) documents.

detaileddescription.para: It is designed to allow the creation of multiple backends for each port, although currently just one is available. It differs from wxHtmlWindow in that each backend is actually a full rendering engine, Internet Explorer or Edge on MSW and WebKit on macOS and GTK. This allows the correct viewing of complex pages with JavaScript and CSS.

sect1.title: Backend Descriptions
sect1.para: This class supports using multiple backends, corresponding to different implementations of the same functionality. Under macOS and Unix platforms only a single, WebKit-based, backend is currently provided, but under MSW both the legacy IE backend and the new Edge backend exist. Backends are identified by their names, documented in the backend descriptions below.

sect2.title: wxWEBVIEW_BACKEND_IE (MSW)
sect2.para: The IE backend uses Microsoft's WebBrowser control, which depends the locally installed version of Internet Explorer. By default this backend emulates Internet Explorer 7. This can be changed with a registry setting by wxWebViewIE::MSWSetEmulationLevel() see this article for more information.
This backend has full support for custom schemes and virtual file systems.
The predefined wxWebViewBackendIE constant contains the name of this backend and can be used to explicitly select it when using wxWebView::New().

simplesect.para: If you plan to display any modern web content you should consider using wxWEBVIEW_BACKEND_EDGE (MSW), as Internet Explorer is not supported anymore by Microsoft.

sect2.title: wxWEBVIEW_BACKEND_EDGE (MSW)
sect2.para: The Edge backend uses Microsoft's Edge WebView2. It is available for Windows 7 and newer.
This backend does not support custom schemes and virtual file systems.

This backend is not enabled by default, to build it follow these steps:
Visual Studio 2015 or newer, or GCC/Clang with c++11 is required
With CMake just enable wxUSE_WEBVIEW_EDGE
When not using CMake:
Download the WebView2 SDK nuget package (Version 1.0.705.50 or newer)
Extract the package (it's a zip archive) to wxWidgets/3rdparty/webview2 (you should have 3rdparty/webview2/build/native/include/WebView2.h file after unpacking it)
Enable wxUSE_WEBVIEW_EDGE in setup.h
Build wxWidgets webview library
Copy WebView2Loader.dll from the subdirectory corresponding to the architecture used (x86 or x64) of wxWidgets/3rdparty/webview2/build/ to your applications executable
At runtime you can use wxWebView::IsBackendAvailable() to check if the backend can be used (it will be available if WebView2Loader.dll can be loaded and Edge (Chromium) is installed)
Make sure to add a note about using the WebView2 SDK to your application documentation, as required by its licence
With Visual Studio 2019 or newer wxUSE_WEBVIEW_EDGE_STATIC can be used to static link the loader and remove the dependency on WebView2Loader.dll at runtime.
If enabled and available at runtime Edge will be selected as the default backend. If you require the IE backend use wxWebViewBackendIE when using wxWebView::New().
If your application should use a fixed version of the WebView2 runtime you must use wxWebViewEdge::MSWSetBrowserExecutableDir() to specify its usage before using the Edge backend.
The predefined wxWebViewBackendEdge constant contains the name of this backend.

sect2.title: wxWEBVIEW_WEBKIT (GTK)
sect2.para: Under GTK the WebKit backend uses WebKitGTK+. The current minimum version required is 1.3.1 which ships by default with Ubuntu Natty and Debian Wheezy and has the package name libwebkitgtk-dev.
Custom schemes and virtual files systems are supported under this backend, however embedded resources such as images and stylesheets are currently loaded using the data:// scheme.
The predefined wxWebViewBackendWebKit constant contains the name of this backend.

sect2.title: wxWEBVIEW_WEBKIT2 (GTK3)
sect2.para: Under GTK3 the WebKit2 version of WebKitGTK+ is used. In Ubuntu the required package name is libwebkit2gtk-4.0-dev and under Fedora it is webkitgtk4-devel.
All features are supported except for clearing and enabling / disabling the history.
The predefined wxWebViewBackendWebKit constant contains the name of this backend.

sect2.title: wxWEBVIEW_WEBKIT (macOS)
sect2.para: The macOS WebKit backend uses Apple's WKWebView class.

This backend has full support for custom schemes and virtual file systems on macOS 10.13+. In order to use handlers two-step creation has to be used and RegisterHandler() has to be called before Create().

Starting with macOS 10.11 and iOS 9 an application cannot create unsecure connections (this includes HTTP and unverified HTTPS). You have to include additional fields in your Info.plist to enable such connections. For further details see the documentation on NSAppTransportSecurity here
The predefined wxWebViewBackendWebKit constant contains the name of this backend.

sect1.title: Asynchronous Notifications
sect1.para: Many of the methods in wxWebView are asynchronous, i.e. they return immediately and perform their work in the background. This includes functions such as LoadURL() and Reload(). To receive notification of the progress and completion of these functions you need to handle the events that are provided. Specifically wxEVT_WEBVIEW_LOADED notifies when the page or a sub-frame has finished loading and wxEVT_WEBVIEW_ERROR notifies that an error has occurred.

sect1.title: Virtual File Systems and Custom Schemes
sect1.para: wxWebView supports the registering of custom scheme handlers, for example file or http. To do this create a new class which inherits from wxWebViewHandler, where wxWebHandler::GetFile() returns a pointer to a wxFSFile which represents the given url. You can then register your handler with RegisterHandler() it will be called for all pages and resources.
wxWebViewFSHandler is provided to access the virtual file system encapsulated by wxFileSystem. The wxMemoryFSHandler documentation gives an example of how this may be used.
wxWebViewArchiveHandler is provided to allow the navigation of pages inside a zip archive. It supports paths of the form: scheme:///C:/example/docs.zip;protocol=zip/main.htm
The following event handler macros redirect the events to member function handlers 'func' with prototypes like: voidhandlerFuncName(wxWebViewEvent&event)

Event macros for events emitted by this class:
EVT_WEBVIEW_NAVIGATING(id, func): Process a wxEVT_WEBVIEW_NAVIGATING event, generated before trying to get a resource. This event may be vetoed to prevent navigating to this resource. Note that if the displayed HTML document has several frames, one such event will be generated per frame.
EVT_WEBVIEW_NAVIGATED(id, func): Process a wxEVT_WEBVIEW_NAVIGATED event generated after it was confirmed that a resource would be requested. This event may not be vetoed. Note that if the displayed HTML document has several frames, one such event will be generated per frame.
EVT_WEBVIEW_LOADED(id, func): Process a wxEVT_WEBVIEW_LOADED event generated when the document is fully loaded and displayed. Note that if the displayed HTML document has several frames, one such event will be generated per frame.
EVT_WEBVIEW_ERROR(id, func): Process a wxEVT_WEBVIEW_ERROR event generated when a navigation error occurs. The integer associated with this event will be a wxWebNavigationError item. The string associated with this event may contain a backend-specific more precise error message/code.
EVT_WEBVIEW_NEWWINDOW(id, func): Process a wxEVT_WEBVIEW_NEWWINDOW event, generated when a new window is created. You must handle this event if you want anything to happen, for example to load the page in a new window or tab.
EVT_WEBVIEW_TITLE_CHANGED(id, func): Process a wxEVT_WEBVIEW_TITLE_CHANGED event, generated when the page title changes. Use GetString to get the title.
EVT_WEBVIEW_FULL_SCREEN_CHANGED(id, func): Process a EVT_WEBVIEW_FULL_SCREEN_CHANGED event, generated when the page wants to enter or leave fullscreen. Use GetInt to get the status. Not implemented for the IE backend and is only available in wxWidgets 3.1.5 or later.
EVT_WEBVIEW_SCRIPT_MESSAGE_RECEIVED(id, func): Process a wxEVT_WEBVIEW_SCRIPT_MESSAGE_RECEIVED event only available in wxWidgets 3.1.5 or later. For usage details see AddScriptMessageHandler().
wxEVT_WEBVIEW_SCRIPT_RESULT(id, func): Process a wxEVT_WEBVIEW_SCRIPT_RESULT event only available in wxWidgets 3.1.6 or later. For usage details see RunScriptAsync().
2.9.3
Library:wxWebView
